description: Demolition of existing buildings and structures and re-development comprising the construction of five industrial units (B1(c)/B2/B8 uses) with ancillary offices, means of access, car and cycle parking facilities, drainage, landscaping, plant and ancillary works. (amended plans received)
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the
proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (30497-FE-03, Preliminary Ecology Appraisal (dated 14 October 2016), Design and Construction Method Statement (Version 01 dated 20 March 2017), Bat Survey (dated June 2017), Landscape Management Schedule (dated 29 June 2017) Geo environmental Investigation and Assessment (dated March 2017), Ground Investigation of Northern Bund (dated May 2017), Overheating Risk Analysis (issue 3 dated June 2017), Very Special Circumstances Report (dated June 2017), Landscape and Visual Appraisal and Green Belt Review (dated June 2017), Air Quality Assessment (dated June 2017), Aviation Constraints Report (dated 29 June 2017), Design and Access Statement (dated June 2017), Economic Impact Statement (dated June 2017), Noise Impact Assessment (dated 20 June 2017), Planning Statement (dated June 2017), Framework Travel Plan (dated June 2017) and Transport Statement (dated June 2017) received on 10 July 2017, Flood Risk Assessment (dated 10 August 2017), 30497-PL-210, PL220, 30497-FE-120, FE-121, FE -123, FE -124, FE - 126, FE -127, FE - 129 and FE - 130 received on 18 September 2017, PL - 235 received on 7 September 2017, Construction Logistics Plan received on 21 September 2017, External Lighting and CCTV Strategy received on 24 August 2017, Energy Strategy dated 5th September 2017, 30497- PL -121E, PL - 122A and PL - 245B received on 4th October 2017, 713.29.03 rev C, 713.39.03 rev B and 713.59.03 rev C received on 29 September 2017, 14-0059D_300 P7  received on 30 November 2017 and 10.07 rev A, 713.19.02 rev C and 713.49.04 rev D received on 24 January 2018.) therewith and approved by the
Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the
Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - 3.	Prior to the occupation of the units hereby approved on the site full details of planting shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of trees and plants, noting species, sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme

Condition : 4 - 4.	Prior to the occupation of the units approved on the site plans shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the use hereby permitted is commenced.

Condition : 5 - 5.	Prior to the occupation of the units hereby approved on the site full details including plans and elevations of cycle parking facilities (including showers and changing rooms) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to first occupation.

Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved on the site the following
plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority :
?h A car park management plan.
?h A delivery and servicing plan.
?h Details of Electrical Vehicle Charging Points
The works shall be carried out as approved prior to occupation of the units.

Condition : 7 - 7.	The units hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.
Condition : 8 - 8.	The development shall be implemented in accordance with the recommendations of the Ecology Appraisal (dated 14th October 2016) received on 10 July 2017.

Condition : 9 - 9.	Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved a Noise Report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing operation levels and mitigation measures proposed. The development shall operate in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 10 - 10.	Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved an Air Quality Report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing operation levels and mitigation measures proposed. The development shall operate in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved details of provisions
made to connect the site to a future District Heating Network shall be submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 12 - 12.	The application shall be implemented in accordance with the Energy Strategy (dated June 2017) received on 5 September 2017.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the recommendations
of the submitted geo-environmental report.
During the course of the development:
a. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional
contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent
person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning
Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.
b. The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in the submitted geo
environmental report, including any amendments in respect of clause a) above, shall
be fully implemented prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved and a
written validation (closure) report will be submitted for approval within 6 months of
first occupation or another timescale agreed in writing with the local planning
authority.

Condition : 14 - Prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved the applicant shall have
entered into a formal agreement with Transport for London to secure highway works,
details of which shall have been submitted to and approved by the relevant highways
authority. The works shall include the closure of the existing egress onto the The Causeway (A312) and shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development.

Condition : 15 - The proposed motorcycle parking spaces on site shall not be used/ converted
for the parking of cars at any time.

Condition : 16 - Prior to commencement of works (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit a final detailed drainage design including drawings to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval. Where the applicant has made material changes to the approved surface water drainage proposals (including the Drainage Assessment Form, drawing 14-0059D_300P7 and associated calculations) submitted to the LLFA in November 2017, revised calculations, Drainage Assessment Form and maintenance plan must be submitted to support the detailed design and ensure no more than a 25 l/s runoff rate from the site.

Condition : 17 - No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan.
